			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-a8306c8dacd5acf9f7fd8426b777ff5a">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2017</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Miriam Perales :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3702">Healthcare in the U.S.</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/miriam%20perales.jpg" title="Miriam Perales " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3702-K-S8ErmVAeQ" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/miriam%20perales.jpg?itok=SLuruRg6" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>During her last semester before graduating, Miriam Perales studied health seeking behaviors in the small community of Mae Sot, which lies at the border between Thailand and Myanmar. This experience coupled with her senior thesis research on <em>curanderismo</em> confirmed her decision to pursue a career in medicine to work specifically with communities of color that lack sufficient health services. Miriam is currently employed as a medical technician at Eye Physicians of the East Bay where she interacts with patients, works alongside optometrists and opthamalogists, and learns about  ocular health complications and diseases.  She is also applying to post-baccalaureate-pre-med programs with the ultimate plan of serving her community as a <em>doctora</em>.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3702">Read more about Miriam's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Kristen Wilson :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3696">Immigration and the Cultural Geography of the U.S.</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/kristen%20wilson.jpg" title="Kristen Wilson " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3696-K-S8ErmVAeQ" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/kristen%20wilson.jpg?itok=xvhoG_Ux" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating with Highest Honors from the American Studies and English programs in May 2017, Kristen Wilson, the Departmental Citation recipient for 2017, spent the summer traveling to console herself on the end of her undergraduate career.  She plans to apply to graduate programs in American Studies and History in order to subject herself to at least another half decade of research, writing, and revision, with an eye towards a lifetime of such labor.  Her ultimate ambition is to encourage similar dedication to and fulfillment through careful research, critical thought, and concise writing in the students she manages to trick into enjoying their academic pursuits.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3696">Read more about Kristen's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2016</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Daniel Acree :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3615">Gender and American Popular Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/danny%20acree.png" title="Daniel Acree " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3615-K-S8ErmVAeQ" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/danny%20acree.png?itok=ssZC_WaK" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>As a graduating Student Veteran still attached to the U.S. Army Reserves, Staff Sergeant Acree continues his personal mission to provide his comrades, as well as all others, with improved life chances by advocating for higher education. Daniel is pursuing a single-subject teaching credential with a Master’s in Education at the University of California, Davis. He would like to be a lifelong thinker, joker, educator, and organizer. Daniel and his partner, Alayna Fredricks, enjoy their happy little life and home in sunny wherever-the-road-leads, California.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3615">Read more about Daniel's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Alec Kassin :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3613">Policy, Politics, and Sport in the U.S.</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/alec%20kassin.png" title="Alec Kassin " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3613-K-S8ErmVAeQ" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/alec%20kassin.png?itok=8onxI43p" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Alec, the Departmental Citation recipient for 2016, graduated with Highest Honors after a longer-than-expected college career, marked by a high of spending a year studying abroad in France, and a low of taking a year off from Berkeley due to a back injury. In the summer after his graduation, he plans to work as a camp counselor for an American-style summer camp in Japan, helping Japanese youth learn English by participating in American sports. In October, he will begin work in LinkedIn's Business Leadership Program, rotating through multiple sales units before taking on a full-time role in their Global Sales Organization. Though his long-term plans are unclear (they may consist of a return to academia to earn a Master's in Public Policy, a run for political office, or both), Alec’s ultimate goal is to have a career through which he can find fulfillment helping others. Right now, Alec is engrossed in learning about the causes, effects, and possible solutions to widening inequality in American society.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3613">Read more about Alec's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Sha Quasha Morgan :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3614">Race, Culture, and Health</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/sha%20quasha%20morgan.png" title="Sha Quasha Morgan " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3614-K-S8ErmVAeQ" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/sha%20quasha%20morgan.png?itok=WootfTJy" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Because she is passionate about being a model for success for students that come from the same background, Sha Quasha will pursue counseling for low income, first generation college students. Following summer, Sha Quasha hopes to work either as a College and Career Counselor in the Oakland Unified School District or as an Academic Advisor within the community college system. Subsequently, she plans to pursue a Master’s in Social Work with an emphasis on either Child and Family Welfare or Community Mental Health. Sha Quasha’s ultimate goal is to provide more awareness to her community about the mental health issues that adversely affect them and necessary support. </p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3614">Read more about Sha Quasha's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-e40c2ace0bdb547c3196cf9e6199e68a">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2016</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Kelly Naze :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3611">American Consumer Society</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/NazeKelly.jpg" title="Kelly Naze " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3611-lyOwrQfLvz4" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/NazeKelly.jpg?itok=AO9Sjkow" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating with honors and ending a lifelong swimming career, Kelly returned home to Denver, Colorado, where she will put her competitive spirit and passion for planning to work as she starts her own business as a wedding planner.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3611">Read more about Kelly's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Vanessa Padilla :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3612">Urban Communities and Education</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/vanessa%20padilla2.png" title="Vanessa Padilla " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3612-lyOwrQfLvz4" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/vanessa%20padilla2.png?itok=X5VB2AbP" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>The summer after graduation Vanessa immersed herself in French language and culture while living in Paris.  On her return to the states, Vanessa continues to intern for Congresswoman Nancy Pelosi, serving constituents in San Francisco.  Vanessa plans to pursue a degree in environmental law, so that she can advocate for people who face environmental crises like those she addressed in her senior thesis.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3612">Read more about Vanessa's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2015</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Isis Dillard :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3580">Politics, Law, and Race</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Isis%20Dillard.png" title="Isis Dillard " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3580-lyOwrQfLvz4" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Isis%20Dillard.png?itok=RIanajB6" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduation, Isis plans to build a career that excites her passion for communication, digital marketing, and social media. Starting January 2016, she will be working full time as a Market Development Representative for a technical recruitment company called TalentBin in San Francisco.  Isis's ultimate academic goal is to return to school in 2018 to pursue a Master's of Business Administration and a Master's of Public Administration. These degrees will allow her to make a practical impact on how business institutions intersect with ideas of race, sex, class, gender, and disability.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3580">Read more about Isis's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Neha Goel :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3579">Race, Politics, and Culture </a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/neha%20goel.png" title="Neha Goel " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3579-lyOwrQfLvz4" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/neha%20goel.png?itok=iHdc-wLJ" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduation, Neha, a double major in American Studies and Psychology, moved to the other side of the Bay to serve as the Project Manager for the Healthy Body Image Study at Stanford University and Palo Alto University. This clinical psychology research study aims to improve body image culture on college campuses by offering a suite of programs that are designed to prevent and treat the onset of eating disorder symptomology amongst college women. Neha hopes to attend a clinical psychology doctoral program in the Fall of 2017 and will utilize the racial, social, and political awareness that she gained from her American Studies courses in her future work as a clinician. Neha’s ultimate goal is to work at the intersection of cultural and clinical psychology in order to address the stigma of mental health that affects all individuals, most especially people of color. </p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3579">Read more about Neha's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Alexander Lee-Thomas :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3554">Race and Representation</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Alexander%20Lee-Thomas.jpg" title="Alexander Lee-Thomas " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3554-lyOwrQfLvz4" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Alexander%20Lee-Thomas.jpg?itok=Lar-7J32" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduation, Alexander returned to southern California to spend time with family and pursue internships.  In the Fall of 2015, he will enter the Peter Stark Producing Program at USC's School of Cinematic Arts.  With an MFA, Alexander will work in television and film to increase representation of people of color and "create a new wave in motion pictures."</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3554">Read more about Alexander's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-c1ac26df492d0bc5b607d61cb1961e26">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2015</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Tommy Statkiewicz :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3556">Intersectionality in American Social and Cultural Spaces</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/StatkiewiczT_2015_Picture%20for%20AS%20Website.jpg" title="Tommy Statkiewicz " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3556-SugOZAtmqAA" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/StatkiewiczT_2015_Picture%20for%20AS%20Website.jpg?itok=2zGA1VWj" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>UC Berkeley and the American Studies department have afforded Tommy a newfound voice and confidence that he graciously embodies. While he finalized his senior honors thesis on trans*undocu individuals in America, Tommy apprenticed on three local queer films to indulge his creative instinct. He also completed his Board of Immigration Appeals Level 1 Accredited Representative status with Educators for Fair Consideration (E4FC) and was hired as their Legal Services Coordinator in June of 2015. Tommy plans to attend law school in the fall of 2017 so that he may continue empowering and supporting LGBTQ and undocumented communities. Tommy feels fortunate to have the support of his wife, Clara Mae, with whom he loves exploring the American landscape via road trips and someday plans to travel beyond U.S. borders.</p>
<p> </p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3556">Read more about Tommy's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Allison Wallace :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3555">Race, Gender, and the American Body</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Allison%20Wallace_pic.jpg" title="Allison Wallace " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3555-SugOZAtmqAA" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Allison%20Wallace_pic.jpg?itok=5lfHOU3z" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduation, Allison began working full-time at nonprofit that helps low-income students earn four-year degrees. As a Development and Communications Coordinator, Allison writes grants, crafts promotional material, and supports all philanthropic engagement activities. Though Allison no longer writes cultural studies papers, she thinks about questions of race, nationhood, gender, belonging, and bodies (among other American Studies topics) daily.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3555">Read more about Allison's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2014</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Anavictoria Avila :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3502">Family, Violence, and Youth Development</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Anavictoria%20Avila_0.jpg" title="Anavictoria Avila " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3502-SugOZAtmqAA" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Anavictoria%20Avila_0.jpg?itok=4Fve8Uc8" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduation in May 2014, Anavictoria returned to Southern California to provide post-surgery recovery care for her mother.  She also worked with several community organizations to develop pilot projects for training Anaheim’s youth in civic awareness and engagement.  With the many policy and political changes occurring in the City of Anaheim, Anavictoria wanted to support her community’s youth throughout summer projects so that their voices and concerns influence current policy discussions.  Anavictoria is currently a 2L at Northwestern School of Law, where she hopes to build from the substantive and practical foundation that her American Studies Major provided for serving and advocating for her community.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3502">Read more about Anavictoria's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Shabnam Banerjee-McFarland :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3558">Politics of Cultural Representation</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/shabnam%20banerjee-mcfarland.jpg" title="Shabnam Banerjee-McFarland " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3558-SugOZAtmqAA" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/shabnam%20banerjee-mcfarland.jpg?itok=8hNeLHFS" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After a series of trial-and-error attempts to start a career in fashion retail and marketing, Shabnam Banerjee-McFarland did a 180 turn and channeled her energy into working with non-profits and learning more about the importance of disseminating change-making policy in all popular culture channels. Since January 2015, she has been working in book marketing with Berrett-Koehler Publishers, a mission-based publishing company in Oakland, CA that publishes books on social justice, conscious capitalism, and self-help in order to "Create a World That Works For All." Most recently, she is designing an extensive research program to confront the extreme lack of diversity in publishing, in hopes of elevating voices from communities that are underrepresented in the industry. A true SF native through and through, Shabnam continues to fight to maintain the colorful vibrancy of San Francisco &amp; Oakland by writing for her personal blog and the Berrett-Koehler blog.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3558">Read more about Shabnam's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Sonja Carlson :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3646">American Popular Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/sonja%20carlson.jpg" title="Sonja Carlson " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3646-SugOZAtmqAA" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/sonja%20carlson.jpg?itok=frmimBR6" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Immediately following graduation, Sonja moved from Berkeley to Los Angeles and began working as an administrator at a small independent elementary school.  For two years, she led the after school enrichment program and managed the school’s internal and external communications.  Sonja’s duties increasingly involved working in the admissions office, assisting with prospective parent communications, event coordination, and the collection of admissions data and materials.  Beginning in July 2016, she transitioned from the enrichment coordinator position to the full-time admissions and communications assistant.  Sonja is currently applying to graduate programs in library science and archival studies.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3646">Read more about Sonja's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

		</div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-7a7806373c4877f726f5bc4887b96ee2">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2014</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Patty Chen :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3505">Race, Ethnicity, and Nation</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Patty%20Chen.jpg" title="Patty Chen " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3505-Q01vXPDBGQo" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Patty%20Chen.jpg?itok=EPdOd-WN" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Patty spent the summer after graduation studying for the LSAT and working.  She assisted a lawyer doing every day tasks, such as preparing documents to file in court and maintaining an organized electronic and physical copy of all documents to ensure accurate filing of all documents that relate to the cases the firm worked on.  She is currently a 2L at UCLA School of Law.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3505">Read more about Patty's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Sophia Ng :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3557">Twentieth Century American Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Sophia%20Ng_photo.JPG" title="Sophia Ng " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3557-Q01vXPDBGQo" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Sophia%20Ng_photo.JPG?itok=2Crn-ppu" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating, Sophia Ng worked at Kickstarter in New York City as an Integrity Analyst.  She also served as a Board Member for the National Asian Pacific American Women’s Forum*New York City (NAPAWF*NYC) chapter, where she volunteered her time working on reproductive justice, immigrant rights, and worker advocacy issues.  Sophia is currently a Fulbright Teaching Assistant, teaching English at a secondary school in Gopeng, Perak in Malaysia.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3557">Read more about Sophia's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Mykiyaa Walker-Sanchez :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3504">Race, Healthcare, and Urban Communities</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Mykiyaa%20Walker-Sanchez.jpg" title="Mykiyaa Walker-Sanchez " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3504-Q01vXPDBGQo" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Mykiyaa%20Walker-Sanchez.jpg?itok=5YF-4Ot4" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating in May 2014, Mykiyaa Walker-Sanchez returned home to her first love, Los Angeles, where she spent the summer volunteering at Residential Care Facilities in urban communities and working with adults with developmental disabilities.   With future professional plans to promote positive well being through good health practices in disadvantaged communities of color and to dismantle some of the socioeconomic barriers that disproportionately affect communities of color, Mykiyaa will pursue a career in medicine as an internal medicine physician. She is currently completing a pre-medicine post-baccalaureate program.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3504">Read more about Mykiyaa's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2013</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Theresa Berger :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3408">Twentieth Century American Cultural History</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Theresa%20Berger.jpg" title="Theresa Berger " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3408-Q01vXPDBGQo" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Theresa%20Berger.jpg?itok=KPgp5EhS" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Since October 2013, Theresa has been working as a substitute teacher for a high school Advanced Placement English Literature class, where she loves using her American Studies background to draw on history, movies, and culture as ways to engage students and show them that what they are reading is more than just a series of words on a page.  She has also been a section leader and course assistant for a number of American Studies courses, including: AS 188D: San Francisco Detectives and AS 188K: American Horrors: Monsters in US Cinema and Literature (Summer 2013); AS 111/ English C136: The Great Exhaling (Spring 2014); AS 101: World War II (Fall 2014); and AS 101: World War II and AS C111/ English C136: The Gilded Age (Fall 2015).  In August 2016 Theresa will begin the Master's in History program at San Francisco State University, and on completion will apply to Ph.D. programs.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3408">Read more about Theresa's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Patricia Boone :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3399">Race, Law, and Juvenile Delinquency</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Patricia%20Boone.jpg" title="Patricia Boone " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3399-Q01vXPDBGQo" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Patricia%20Boone.jpg?itok=Ps1wkFrp" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Shortly after graduation in May 2013, Patricia packed her car and drove solo heading East with an eagerness to take what she learned at UC Berkeley and explore an expanding world.  Her road trip took a total of ten days, during which Patricia camped under the stars in Utah, danced in cowboy saloons in Wyoming, and witnessed electric skies over Nebraska.  In 2016 Patricia graduated from Northwestern School of Law, and and co-founded CompassBlu, LLC, a synergistic and diverse consulting firm that connects people to their purpose, producing results that inspire global change.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3399">Read more about Patricia's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-3c1ca558513fa5e79fc9a530675f2969">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2013</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Robert Cancio :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3409">Economic Effects of Immigration</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Robert%20Cancio.jpg" title="Robert Cancio " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3409-73GSM4yfp-g" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Robert%20Cancio.jpg?itok=jJxbLz_Z" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After a May 2013 graduation, Robert moved back to Los Angeles to spend time with his family before embarking on a cross-country trip cutting through the southern United States.  He backpacked in Tuolumne Meadows in Yosemite; hiked through the Grand Canyon in Arizona; visited Fort Selden State Monument, a former United States Army post for the Buffalo soldiers in New Mexico; toured the Alamo in Texas; feasted on Cajun shrimp in New Orleans; and visited Disney World in Florida--a trip her is certain American Studies students would appreciate.  Robert is currently pursuing a Ph.D. in Sociology at the University of Miami, where he hopes to build on his interdisciplinary training in American Studies.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3409">Read more about Robert's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Jen Kim :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3410">Public Policy and the Urban Community</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Jen%20Kim.jpg" title="Jen Kim " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3410-73GSM4yfp-g" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Jen%20Kim.jpg?itok=SoQEI69z" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>During the summer following a May 2013 graduation, Jen worked as a public housing organizer for a community-based organization in the Lower East Side of New York City.  She is currently working toward a Master's in Urban and Regional Planning at UCLA, with a focus on community economic development and housing.  She is most interested in learning about alternative development models and plans to continue organizing for more equitable communities.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3410">Read more about Jen's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Dani Nameth :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3484">Food and Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Dani%20Nameth_0.jpg" title="Dani Nameth " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3484-73GSM4yfp-g" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Dani%20Nameth_0.jpg?itok=YFDYjYvI" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After finishing her last semester in December of 2012, Dani spent her final academic time abroad in the United Kingdom studying food science at the University of Leeds.  She has recently moved back to Southern California to focus on Clinical and Translational research.  She is currently working as a Public Administrative Analyst for Phase 2 and 3 Clinical trials for novel treatments in both Sarcoma and Lung Cancer.  Dani has also recently been published in the Journal of American Medicine Dermatology for an epidemiological paper looking at the scope of exposure to indoor tanning.  Dani continues to bring food, nutrition, and medicine into conversation working on research that focuses on the role of BMI and overall survival in cancer patients while she applies to medical school.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3484">Read more about Dani's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Jennifer Schaefer :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3486">Education in America</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Jen%20Schaefer.jpg" title="Jennifer Schaefer " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3486-73GSM4yfp-g" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Jen%20Schaefer.jpg?itok=efTZaav8" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Following graduation in May 2013, Jennifer spent a year working as a math tutor and saving money in order to move to Oahu in pursuit of a slower, balanced lifestyle, the Aloha Spirit, and warmer weather.  In Fall 2014, she will begin to work towards a Ph.D. in Mathematics at the University of Hawaii, hoping either to conduct mathematics research or to become a community college professor.  In either case, Jennifer will offer free math tutoring (and possibly dance lessons) to those who are not able to afford it.  She strives to emphasize education for the sake of learning, and to challenge the commodification of education that strictly purports the acquisition of a financially rewarding job.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3486">Read more about Jennifer's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Robyn Taylor :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3411">Mind, Language, and Movement</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Robyn%20Taylor.jpg" title="Robyn Taylor " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3411-73GSM4yfp-g" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Robyn%20Taylor.jpg?itok=O9BkUMAf" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating in May 2013, Robyn Taylor took part in a professional six-week dance intensive workshop in Toubab Dialow, Senegal at Ecole des Sables.  The teaching at this dance workshop consisted of various traditional West African dance forms as well as contemporary dance and choreographic techniques.  Robyn is currently residing in Paris, France where she is studying contemporary dance at Menagerie de Verre.  Fascinated by the movement and ethos of Paris, Robyn observes the metro system, the grocery stores, and various art creations ranging from the highly commercialized to the subversive.  She writes about these observations on her blog.  She is currently collaborating with three dancers and four graffiti artists on a performance piece that will take place in a street artists’ squat December 14.  Next, Robyn will go to Salvador, Bahia, Brazil, where she will continue her dance studies in the Silvestre Technique.  Robyn applied this fall for the Fulbright Fellowship 2014, and in the upcoming year she hopes to continue her investigation of identity and dance in Senegal.  Her Fulbright proposal is titled: "Rhythm in Dakar: The Kinesthetic Exchange of Dance within a Globalized Context."</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3411">Read more about Robyn's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-7b775937f46ddceb0888bab5a8b0914f">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2013</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Eli Wirtschafter :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3412">Visual, Literary, and Performance Cultures</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Eli%20Wirtschafter.jpg" title="Eli Wirtschafter " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3412-brsAb9k2rCU" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Eli%20Wirtschafter.jpg?itok=vFtzHeDu" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>The Departmental Citation winner for 2013 for both American Studies and Theater, Dance &amp; Performance Studies, for his honors thesis Eli wrote a historical paper, and wrote and directed a play based on that research.  Eli is currently a reporter for San Francisco's public radio station, KALW.  Tune in to <em>Crosscurrents</em>, weekdays at 5 on 91.7. </p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3412">Read more about Eli's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2012</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Wendy Bravo :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3413">Health and Minority Communities</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Wendy%20Bravo.jpg" title="Wendy Bravo " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3413-brsAb9k2rCU" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Wendy%20Bravo.jpg?itok=W1D6Rq-C" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating in December 2012, Wendy began working full-time with Brown &amp; Toland Medical Group in San Francisco.  Her work mainly focuses on analyzing the implementation of accountable care organizations (ACOs)--a new payment method for doctors, where payments are determined by the overall health of a patient, rather than by how many tests or exams a patient received.  Wendy has also continued her volunteer work in community health and soon hopes to become a certified Covered California counselor to help people sign up for health insurance through the state’s health exchange.  Wendy plans on returning to school to complete the requirements for medical school and pursue a career as a primary care doctor.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3413">Read more about Wendy's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Yi-Ning Chiu :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3398">Race, Nation, and International Relations, 1945-Present</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Yi-Ning%20Chiu.jpg" title="Yi-Ning Chiu " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3398-brsAb9k2rCU" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Yi-Ning%20Chiu.jpg?itok=251yzLzd" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>After graduating in 2012, Yi-Ning worked briefly for an online education startup before returning to the American Studies department, where she was a section leader for American Studies 10: "Hollywood: The Place, the Industry, the Fantasy."  After continuing to work as a Reader for American Studies courses and co-pastoring the college fellowship of Ark Ministries of Berkeley, a local non-denominational, multi-ethnic church, Yi-Ning joined the team at Year Up, an award-winning national 501(c)3 organization striving to close the Opportunity Divide by equipping urban young adults ages 18-24 to reach their potential through professional careers and higher education.  She works there as an Internship Services Specialist.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3398">Read more about Yi-Ning's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>David Swatt :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3414">Environmental Management and Policy</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/david%20swatt.png" title="David Swatt " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3414-brsAb9k2rCU" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/david%20swatt.png?itok=drx2eTHU" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Since graduation in 2012, David returned to Los Angeles, and began a full-time career selling residential real estate with the highest grossing office in the United States, Coldwell Banker-Beverly Hills North.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3414">Read more about David's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2009</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Cleavon Gilman :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3396">Diversity and Mobility in the U.S.</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/clevon.jpg" title="Cleavon Gilman " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3396-brsAb9k2rCU" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/clevon.jpg?itok=nqQvxJb9" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p><span>After graduating in 2009, Cleavon completed a post-Baccalaureate in Physiology at California State University East Bay.  In 2016 he became of Doctor of Medicine after completing training at UCSF<span>.</span><br /></span></p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3396">Read more about Cleavon's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Profile of Graduates</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div class="view view-graduates view-id-graduates view-display-id-page view-dom-id-f967634346d29bc468f5bbf19a228dea">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2009</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Jessica Gresham :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3618">Twentieth Century American Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Jessica%20Gresham.jpg" title="Jessica Gresham " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3618-849VZyycjrY" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Jessica%20Gresham.jpg?itok=joiT2iyM" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Jessica graduated with honors in 2009, and she currently works as a Veterinary Assistant at the San Francisco SPCA.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3618">Read more about Jessica's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Adrienne Johnson :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3617">Consumer Society &amp; Contemporary American Culture</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Adrienne%20Johnson.jpg" title="Adrienne Johnson " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3617-849VZyycjrY" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Adrienne%20Johnson.jpg?itok=rhn1JGTh" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>The Departmental Citation Winner for 2009, Adrienne recently completed her PhD in the Modern Thought and Literature program at Stanford.  Titled <em>Diet and the Disease of Civilization, 1977-2008</em>, Adrienne's dissertation analyzes how instructional texts — diet books, nutrition policy, medical research — have measured civilization by the human costs of social progress.  Other academic publications include articles on competitive eating, Paleo diet mythologies, dude ranches, locavorism, and grocery store couponing. She also writes for popular, non-academic audiences in BuzzFeed Food and <em>Gastronomica</em>.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3617">Read more about Adrienne's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Everardo Mora :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3397">City Planning, Public Policy, and Minority Communities</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/everardo.jpg" title="Everardo Mora " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3397-849VZyycjrY" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/everardo.jpg?itok=bTD2Ia7r" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p><span>As one of four recipients of the 2009 Judith Lee Stronach Baccalaureate Prize, Everardo Mora received $20,000 and a Visiting Scholar placement at UC Berkeley in order to continue his research on "cannery culture." His goal was to produce a narrative infused with the voices, stories, and experiences of Latino cannery workers in order to better understand ethnic diversity, the culture of mass production, language and literacy, and identity construction on the shop floor of the last full-scale cannery to close in the Silicon Valley, a valley that once was known as the Valley of Heart's Delight. Everardo currently works as a Project Manager at Orton Development, Inc.<br /></span></p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3397">Read more about Everardo's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Folasade Scott :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3503">The Mind, the Arts, and Education in America</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Folasade%20Scott.jpeg" title="Folasade Scott " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3503-849VZyycjrY" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Folasade%20Scott.jpeg?itok=ShLHJnAS" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <p>Since 2009 Folasade has been privileged to enrich people’s lives as a minister, teacher, counselor, and mentor, serving in various parts of the US, as well as Jamaica and Haiti; she has also remotely served people in other countries such as Qatar, Pakistan, Kenya, and Canada. Folasade specializes in restoration and development of the whole person; authentic identity expression; basic and academic life skills development; global community awareness and service; sustainability; and creative expression. She also serves as a consultant and collaborator with organizations and individuals who desire to enrich people’s lives holistically. These services are expressed through two business entities that Folasade founded and directs: a non-profit corporation called Violent Faith Ministries International Inc. and a for-profit business called Redeeming the Time. Folasade is currently completing a Master's program at Winston-Salem State University called Teaching English as a Second Language and Applied Linguistics; she plans to pursue a PhD in Educational Psychology at Georgia State University.</p>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3503">Read more about Folasade's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
  <h3>Class of <span class="date-display-single">2008</span></h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 clearfix">
      
          <h3 class="title"><strong>Josh Begley :</strong> - <a href="graduates/detail/3619">Race, Identity, and Narrative in the U.S.</a></h3>    
          <div class="field-content image-people grid_2"><a href="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/Josh%20Begley.jpg" title="Josh Begley " class="colorbox" data-colorbox-gallery="gallery-node-3619-849VZyycjrY" data-cbox-img-attrs="{&quot;title&quot;: &quot;&quot;, &quot;alt&quot;: &quot;&quot;}"><img src="http://as.ugis.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/styles/people/public/Josh%20Begley.jpg?itok=LGsjn-w1" width="125" height="155" alt="" title="" /></a></div>    
          <div>Josh Begley is a data artist and web developer based in Brooklyn, New York. He is the creator of Metadata+, an iPhone app that tracks U.S. drone strikes. His work has appeared in <em>Wired</em>, <em>The New York Times</em>, <em>NPR</em>, <em>The Atlantic</em>, <em>The Guardian</em>, <em>New York Magazine</em>, and at the New Museum of Contemporary Art. </div>
<div> </div>
<div>A graduate of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, Josh currently works at <em>The Intercept</em>, a publication of First Look Media. See more at <a href="http://joshbegley.com">joshbegley.com</a></div>
 <div class="read-more-grad"><a href="graduates/detail/3619">Read more about Josh's Thesis and Area of Concentration</a></div>    </div>
    </div>

			<div id="post-content-wrap" class="grid_12"> 
			<h2 class="inner-title">Upper Division Courses</h2>     			
			  <div id="content" >
			  
			    <div class="region region-content">
    <div id="block-system-main" class="block block-system"><div class="widget bottom"><div id="node-3320" class="node node-full-width clearfix">

      
  
  <div class="content clearfix">
    <div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>A total of 30-36 upper-division units are required in the major with at least 20 units in the Area of Concentration. All courses taken to satisfy the major requirements must be taken for a letter grade, and students must maintain a 2.0 GPA in the major in order to graduate.</p>
<p><em>All courses taken to satisfy the major requirements must be taken for a letter grade.</em></p>
<h3>Core Methods Courses (8 units)</h3>
<p>* Examining U.S. Cultures in Time<br /> * Examining U.S. Cultures in Place</p>
<p>Students are required to take one course each from the two methods series, "Time" and "Place." It is expected that these courses will be completed during the junior year. See department listings for available courses every semester. Due to the unique interdisciplinary nature of the courses, these requirements should be satisfied at UC Berkeley. Note: "Time" courses include A.S. 101 and A.S. C111 and "Place" courses include A.S. 102 and C112, as well as other courses noted in each semester's department listings.</p>
<h3>Area of Concentration (20-22 units)</h3>
<p>A minimum of six classes (20-22 units) of upper-division course work, drawn from the College of Letters and Science and the Professional Schools and Colleges, are required in the student's individually articulated area of concentration. The area of concentration must include courses from at least two different departments, <span style="text-decoration: underline;">but no more than three courses from any one discipline.</span> The area may include courses from up to six different departments.</p>
<p>Areas of concentration may be highly individualized, depending on the student's intellectual focus, prior preparation, and the availability of courses. Students planning to declare the major should complete a four year plan, major application form and meet with a faculty advisor in their sophomore year or early in their junior year to plan their upper-division program. Subsequently, this program can be revised only with the approval of the faculty advisor. For further information see the <a href="areas-of-concentration">sample areas of concentration</a>.</p>
<h3>Senior Thesis (4 units)</h3>
<p>Because American Studies at UC Berkeley is an interdisciplinary program based on the major's own offerings and supplemented by individualized programs of study drawing on the resources of the whole campus, students in this major complete their work in the major with an interdisciplinary senior thesis. The thesis is intended to give students the opportunity to develop an extended analysis of a significant problem, and to craft the essay into a finished piece of scholarly work. It is designed to give students a sense of competence and confidence in framing, exploring, and completing an explicitly interdisciplinary project. NOTE: The senior thesis course may not be taken before students have completed the American Studies core requirements and most of their area of concentration classes.</p>
<p><strong>American Studies 189</strong> is an optional intensive reading and research seminar that will assist students in the development of skills fundamental to advanced research in the humanities, social sciences and cultural studies. The effort entails identification of research topics, cultivation of interdisciplinary metholodologies, compilation of annotated bibliographies, and completion of a literature review, which may serve as the first portion of the American Studies senior thesis.</p>
<p><strong>There are four ways to satisfy the thesis requirement:</strong></p>
<p><strong><em>1. American Studies 191</em></strong><br /> Students in this course will work together and independently to achieve individual interdisciplinary research papers which draw on their preparatory work in American Studies. Students should prepare for this project over the course of their careers at UC Berkeley, and be ready, by the second week of class, to submit a thesis prospectus, including a working title, a 1-page description of the problem or issue addressed, and a statement of the method or approach which they plan to utilize.</p>
<p><em><strong>2. American Studies 190</strong> (under the direction of an individual faculty member)</em><br /> Students who elect this option must prepare a bibliography and write a brief description of their proposed thesis <strong>the semester before</strong> they plan to enroll in 190. They must also secure a faculty advisor from an appropriate field who will agree to direct the thesis. They must then submit their proposal, along with the signature of their faculty director, to the American Studies office to obtain a course control number. Note: Students who wish to include creative work as part of their thesis requirement may use this option. Students should pick up the blank Thesis Proposal / Faculty Advisor Agreement in 237 Evans Hall.</p>
<p><em><strong>3. American Studies H195 -- Honors Thesis</strong></em><br /> In order to graduate with Honors in the major, eligible students must enroll in A.S. H195 (Senior Honors Thesis). For admission to A.S. H195, students must have senior standing, an overall gradepoint average of 3.51, and a grade-point average of 3.65 for <span style="text-decoration: underline;">all</span> (upper- <span style="text-decoration: underline;">and</span> lower-division) courses taken in completion of the major.</p>
<p><em><strong>4. Thesis Course Offered by Another Department</strong></em><br /> Students may enroll in an upper-division seminar in a department or field appropriate to their area of concentration for which they must write a substantial research paper. This course must be approved in advance by an American Studies faculty advisor.</p>
</div></div></div>  </div>

  
  </div></div><div class="clear"></div></div>  </div>
